evidence_collection.quote_text: Whatever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit rejection of dimension

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is an historic election, and I recognize the special significance it has for African-Americans and for the special pride that must be theirs tonight.
evidence_collection.context_type: central theme

evidence_collection.quote_text: though we have come a long way from the old injustices that once stained our nation's reputation and denied some Americans the full blessings of American citizenship, the memory of them still had the power to wound.
evidence_collection.context_type: historical context

evidence_collection.quote_text: These are difficult times for our country, and I pledge to him tonight to do all in my power to help him lead us through the many challenges we face.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledgement of challenges without crisis framing

evidence_collection.quote_text: But that he managed to do so by inspiring the hopes of so many millions of Americans who had once wrongly believed that they had little at stake or little influence in the election of an American president is something I deeply admire and commend him for achieving.
evidence_collection.context_type: praise of opponent's hopeful message

evidence_collection.quote_text: to not despair of our present difficulties, but to believe always in the promise and greatness of America.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to action

evidence_collection.quote_text: In a contest as long and difficult as this campaign has been, his success alone commands my respect for his ability and perseverance.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit rejection of dimension

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama has achieved a great thing for himself and for his country. I applaud him for it, and offer him my sincere sympathy that his beloved grandmother did not live to see this day
evidence_collection.context_type: central theme

evidence_collection.quote_text: I wish Godspeed to the man who was my former opponent and will be my president, and I call on all Americans... to not despair of our present difficulties
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit rejection of dimension

evidence_collection.quote_text: My friends, we have come to the end of a long journey. The American people have spoken, and they have spoken clearly. A little while ago, I had the honor of calling Senator Barack Obama to congratulate him
evidence_collection.context_type: opening statement

evidence_collection.quote_text: I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together
evidence_collection.context_type: call to action

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama and I have had and argued our differences, and he has prevailed. No doubt many of those differences remain. These are difficult times for our country, and I pledge to him tonight to do all in my power to help him lead us through the many challenges we face.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit rejection of dimension

evidence_collection.quote_text: to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to action

evidence_collection.quote_text: It is natural tonight to feel some disappointment, but tomorrow we must move beyond it and work together to get our country moving again.
evidence_collection.context_type: central theme

evidence_collection.quote_text: Abraham Lincoln talked about a government of the people, by the people, for the people. Well, Trump has a government of the billionaires, by the billionaires, and for the billionaires.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit_outgroup_definition

evidence_collection.quote_text: I don't care if you are a Republican, Democrat, or independent, I don't think there's anybody who thinks it vaguely makes sense that the richest guy in the world could spend $270 million to get Trump elected and then become the most powerful person in the government.
evidence_collection.context_type: cross_partisan_appeal

evidence_collection.quote_text: They are prepared to destroy Social Security, Medicaid, Medicare, the Veterans Administration in order to make themselves even richer.
evidence_collection.context_type: threat_articulation

evidence_collection.quote_text: I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: aspirational_vision_statement

evidence_collection.quote_text: Meanwhile, there has been a $75 trillion transfer of wealth from the bottom 90% to the top 1%. That is what a rigged economy is about, and that is what we are going to change.
evidence_collection.context_type: zero_sum_economic_claim

evidence_collection.quote_text: Now everybody wants to do well in life. Everybody wants to make money. But you would think that if you had a few billion dollars or $10 or $20 billion, you would not feel obliged to step on the backs of poor people to become even richer.
evidence_collection.context_type: rejection_of_outgroup_success

evidence_collection.quote_text: These guys, I want to tell you something because I bump into them in my line of work, they are not nice guys. I know on TV they come across... But they're not.
evidence_collection.context_type: adversarial_characterization

evidence_collection.quote_text: So if we stand together, are strong, are disciplined, are smart, I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: in-group_solidarity_appeal

evidence_collection.quote_text: We will not accept an oligarchic form of society. We will not accept the richest guy in the world running all over Washington, making cuts to the Social Security Administration, cuts to the Veterans Administration...
evidence_collection.context_type: rejection_of_existing_structure

evidence_collection.quote_text: ...we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: integrative_vision_statement

evidence_collection.quote_text: They want us to think that our lives are suffering because of the LGBT kid down the street or because of the mixed status family or the dreamer down the block... But we’re smarter than that Greeley. We know better than that.
evidence_collection.context_type: in_group_definition

evidence_collection.quote_text: Our lives deserve dignity and our work deserves respect.
evidence_collection.context_type: thematic_statement

evidence_collection.quote_text: ...so that they can steal from our healthcare, Social Security, and veterans' benefits to pay for tax cuts for the wealthiest and bailouts for their crypto billionaire friends.
evidence_collection.context_type: threat_perception

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because in this house, we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: collective_vision

evidence_collection.quote_text: They aren’t working for these billions. They’re stealing them. They’re stealing them. They’re stealing them from you and you and me.
evidence_collection.context_type: grievance_rhetoric

evidence_collection.quote_text: No evidence found for this dimension. The speech's focus is on the illegitimate success of an oligarchy, not celebrating the success of others. Its absence is a significant feature of the text.
evidence_collection.context_type: absence_of_evidence

evidence_collection.quote_text: We are witnessing an oligarchy in America. And that is when those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: adversarial_positioning

evidence_collection.quote_text: If you are willing to fight for someone you don’t know, you are welcome here.
evidence_collection.context_type: unity_appeal

evidence_collection.quote_text: We need to come together and spend every day between now and election day working to educate our neighbors, and give Evans and Boebert the boot, and replace them...
evidence_collection.context_type: zero_sum_objective

evidence_collection.quote_text: So I hope that you see this movement is not about partisan labels or purity tests, but about class solidarity.
evidence_collection.context_type: integrative_objective

evidence_collection.quote_text: The American people are outraged at what's going on, and the American people are saying loud and clear, 'We will not accept an oligarchic form of society. We will not accept the richest guy in the world running all over Washington...'
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit 'us' vs. 'them' and assertion of group will

evidence_collection.quote_text: These guys have no sense of what goes on in the real world. They live in another planet.
evidence_collection.context_type: definition of distinct, disconnected out-group

evidence_collection.quote_text: Now everybody wants to do well in life. Everybody wants to make money.
evidence_collection.context_type: implied universal aspiration, but not explicit universal worth

evidence_collection.quote_text: They are prepared to destroy Social Security, Medicaid, Medicare, the Veterans Administration in order to make themselves even richer.
evidence_collection.context_type: description of existential threat to critical social programs

evidence_collection.quote_text: I will tell you this, in the midst of all of these addictions, the worst and most dangerous addiction we have is the greed of the oligarchs.
evidence_collection.context_type: framing an opposing force as a dangerous, pervasive threat

evidence_collection.quote_text: I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: optimistic vision for future contingent on overcoming obstacles

evidence_collection.quote_text: Today you have more concentration of ownership in America than we have ever had... who charge us outrageous prices for the products that we have to buy.
evidence_collection.context_type: resentment over perceived unjust gains of others

evidence_collection.quote_text: there has been a $75 trillion transfer of wealth from the bottom 90% to the top 1%. That is what a rigged economy is about...
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit zero-sum framing of wealth distribution
no evidence found

evidence_collection.quote_text: We will not accept an oligarchic form of society. We will not accept the richest guy in the world running all over Washington...
evidence_collection.context_type: direct opposition and rejection of the identified enemy

evidence_collection.quote_text: And what these guys are busy doing right now is going after Medicaid, going after Social Security, going after nutrition. The rich want to get richer and they don't care who they step on.
evidence_collection.context_type: description of hostile actions by the adversarial group

evidence_collection.quote_text: I don't care if you are a Republican, Democrat, or independent, I don't think there's anybody who thinks it vaguely makes sense that the richest guy in the world could spend $270 million to get Trump elected and then become the most powerful person in the government.
evidence_collection.context_type: attempt to build tactical unity across political lines against a common enemy

evidence_collection.quote_text: We will not accept an oligarchic form of society.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit goal to dismantle an existing power structure

evidence_collection.quote_text: not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit goal to 'defeat' an ideology or movement

evidence_collection.quote_text: we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: positive-sum goal framed as an outcome of overcoming obstacles

evidence_collection.quote_text: we here who take an oath to support and defend the Constitution... we recognize that if we're going to support and defend the Constitution, encouraging the, the nomination and the advice and the consent, the confirmation of the Senate and encouraging then a presidential appointment to the Supreme Court of someone whom the President is incapable of nominating anyone to the Supreme Court that what the Constitution says and what was understood to mean at the time of its ratification
evidence_collection.context_type: Defining an in-group ('we') based on a specific constitutional belief system against an out-group (the President and his potential nominees).

evidence_collection.quote_text: it's costing in the end thousands of lives in America. And the sad, sad story told by Laura Wilkerson yesterday that she has the courage and the heart to come here and share her story with us and to place that awful, brutal, ghastly memory again into her mind's eye...
evidence_collection.context_type: Using a visceral, tragic story of a murder to evoke fear and portray immigration policy as an immediate, mortal threat.

evidence_collection.quote_text: That's 135 dead Americans that would be alive today if the President didn't have the policy of releasing criminal, criminal aliens onto the streets. That's, that's the ones we know of.
evidence_collection.context_type: Quantifying a mortal threat and directly blaming a political opponent's policy for the deaths of Americans.

evidence_collection.quote_text: the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court decided that he could write words into ObamaCare that didn't exist. They were not passed by this Congress, not by either chamber of this Congress... They made it up. And they wrapped themselves in the cloak of constitutional authority in Marberry versus Madison and a whole series of presumably precedent cases along the line.
evidence_collection.context_type: Expressing resentment towards the perceived illegitimate power of the Supreme Court to 'make it up' and act outside of its designated authority, a form of grievance rhetoric.

evidence_collection.quote_text: And instead of being restored, it would be destroyed by another presidential appointment.
evidence_collection.context_type: Framing a political action (a presidential appointment) with hostile and destructive language, positioning it as an act of destruction against the Constitution.

evidence_collection.quote_text: Her life abruptly ended by a criminal alien who had been, and who had been encountered by a law enforcement before, whose immigration attorneys knew him... And he had been released. He'd been released onto the streets where he now had three times the blood alcohol content allowable by law, drag racing in the streets, killed Sarah Root.
evidence_collection.context_type: Identifying a specific individual as a 'criminal alien' and an enemy responsible for the death of an American, positioning the relationship as adversarial and hostile.

evidence_collection.quote_text: No hearing, no, no confirmation in the Senate, no vote in the in the Judiciary Committee, and no vote on the floor of the Senate for this lame duck President's appointments because we have a Constitution that's got to be restored.
evidence_collection.context_type: Articulating a clear zero-sum objective: to completely block the political process for a presidential appointment, which is an inherently divisive goal.

evidence_collection.quote_text: Secure our borders. Restore their respect for the rule of law. Save these lives. Send these people into prison. And when they're done, send them back to the country that they can live in legally for the rest of their lives if they don't stay in our prisons for the rest of their lives.
evidence_collection.context_type: Stating goals of separation, imprisonment, and deportation for a specific group of people, emphasizing division and removal rather than integration.

evidence_collection.quote_text: This illegal alien beat this boy to death and then he went and bought gasoline and burned his body. He hauled his body out and and put gas and poured gasoline on it and burned this Joshua Wilkinson's body and then he went and took a shower and went to a movie as if it was just another day in the life of. Well, Mr. Speaker, it was another day in, in the life of America and Americans. It's another life loss to an, an illegal criminal alien who was unlawfully present in America, who had no business to be here...
evidence_collection.context_type: strong us-vs-them framing, highlighting threat to in-group

evidence_collection.quote_text: ...people over on this side of the aisle have their fingers in their ears on data. But when they see the faces, when they hear the anguish and the voices, especially of the mothers, or the voice of the father, Scott Root...
evidence_collection.context_type: political in-group/out-group distinction

evidence_collection.quote_text: That being one of God's children is good enough to be protected by the law, but everybody treated equally. Secure our borders.
evidence_collection.context_type: qualified universal dignity, immediately limited by exclusionary border rhetoric

evidence_collection.quote_text: That's 135 dead Americans that would be alive today if the President didn't have the policy of releasing criminal, criminal aliens onto the streets.
evidence_collection.context_type: concern for life, but explicitly limited to national identity

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is costing, it's costing in the end thousands of lives in America.
evidence_collection.context_type: existential threat, direct consequence of policy failures

evidence_collection.quote_text: And it bring you to a sad state of mourn. And you'd lay your head down on the pillow at night having trouble to sleep, thinking, 'What am I going to do tomorrow? I couldn't react today. What am I going to do tomorrow? Lord, wake me up with an idea on how to, how to preserve our Constitution,' if the Supreme Court of the United States believes that they can write law.
evidence_collection.context_type: evokes deep distress and crisis over constitutional integrity

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is the time we must defend our Constitution and we must nominate and elect a President of the United States who will make those appointments to the Supreme Court who believe the Constitution means what it says.
evidence_collection.context_type: reactive goal to restore, not a forward-looking vision

evidence_collection.quote_text: Secure our borders. Restore their respect for the rule of law. Save these lives. Send these people into prison. And when they're done, send them back to the country that they can live in legally for the rest of their lives if they don't stay in our prisons for the rest of their lives.
evidence_collection.context_type: goals are defensive and punitive, not optimistic or cohesive

evidence_collection.quote_text: The Supreme Court ruled with the majority opinion written by the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, but they could add words into Obamacare where it says, 'the states may establish exchanges.' They, they added, 'the states or federal government may establish exchanges.' They made it up.
evidence_collection.context_type: resentment towards perceived illegitimate power grab by Supreme Court

evidence_collection.quote_text: He's demonstrated that in the past with his appointments to the court. He will demonstrate that again. We have a Constitution to preserve, protect, defend, and support and defend.
evidence_collection.context_type: implies resentment of presidential appointments undermining constitutional principles

evidence_collection.quote_text: No direct evidence found for this dimension.
evidence_collection.context_type: No content detected that reflects joy from others' success, an abundance mindset, or merit celebration.

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have a lame duck President who has made appointments to the Supreme Court who seem to believe that the Constitution means what they want it to mean and they want to read it uh to say what they want it to say rather than what it actually says and rather than what it actually was understood to mean at the time of its ratification.
evidence_collection.context_type: direct adversarial framing of the President and his appointees

evidence_collection.quote_text: This illegal alien beat this boy to death and then he went and bought gasoline and burned his body... It's another life loss to an, an illegal criminal alien who was unlawfully present in America, who had no business to be here...
evidence_collection.context_type: dehumanizing and hostile portrayal of an 'illegal criminal alien'

evidence_collection.quote_text: we here who take an oath to support and defend the Constitution—and that's actually all of us here in the House of Representatives, Mr. Speaker, and everyone in the United States Senate for that matter—we recognize that if we're going to support and defend the Constitution, encouraging the, the nomination and the advice and the consent, the confirmation of the Senate and encouraging then a presidential appointment to the Supreme Court of someone whom the President is incapable of nominating anyone to the Supreme Court that what the Constitution says and what was understood to mean at the time of its ratification, he's demonstrated that in the past with his appointments to the court.
evidence_collection.context_type: conditional in-group amity, immediately followed by criticism of political opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: I thank God for Laura Wilkinson and I ask God to bless the life and the memory and the soul of Joshua Wilkinson who has paid a tremendously high price because we have an ideological President who, I'd say to the other side of the aisle, who's not doing his job.
evidence_collection.context_type: expression of empathy for victims within a partisan framework

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have a lame duck President who has made appointments to the Supreme Court who seem to believe that the Constitution means what they want it to mean and they want to read it uh to say what they want it to say rather than what it actually says and rather than what it actually was understood to mean at the time of its ratification.
evidence_collection.context_type: identifying and condemning those with opposing constitutional interpretations

evidence_collection.quote_text: There's no right in the Constitution for a same-sex marriage... It's a complete manufactured, not just a right, but a command by the Supreme Court of the United States.
evidence_collection.context_type: denying legitimacy of judicial action, fostering division

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is the constitutional structure of this government that we have, Mr. Speaker, and it's, it's a bit um, frustrating for me to listen to the dialogue otherwise that the Senate's not doing their job because they withhold a confirmation, uh, of a presidential appointment when we have a President that has proven that he's not going to put up an appointment that will protect our Constitution.

evidence_collection.quote_text: if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: optimistic vision of success

evidence_collection.quote_text: those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: zero-sum framing

evidence_collection.quote_text: They're not working for these billions. They're stealing them. They're stealing them. They're stealing them from you and you and me.
evidence_collection.context_type: accusation of ill-gotten gains

evidence_collection.quote_text: I believe in healthcare, labor, and human dignity, because I was a waitress, because I've scrubbed toilets with my mom to afford school, because I've worked double shifts to keep the lights on, because I lost my dad to cancer as a kid and had to see my mom open hospital bills in the days after.
evidence_collection.context_type: personal narrative of hardship

evidence_collection.quote_text: We are witnessing an oligarchy in America. And that is when those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: designation of adversary

evidence_collection.quote_text: those leaders on either side of the aisle who are willing to put their fellow Americans down... those folks may best find a home somewhere else.
evidence_collection.context_type: exclusion of opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: call for unity

evidence_collection.quote_text: It's about class solidarity.
evidence_collection.context_type: defining shared purpose

evidence_collection.quote_text: we need to come together and spend every day between now and election day working to educate our neighbors, and give Evans and Boebert the boot, and replace them with a brawling Democrat who will stand for Colorado.
evidence_collection.context_type: objective to remove opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: The same billionaires are taking a wrecking ball to our country
evidence_collection.context_type: description of destructive actions

evidence_collection.quote_text: It's about the thousands of you who came out today to stand together and say, 'Our lives deserve dignity and our work deserves respect.'
evidence_collection.context_type: collective aspiration

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because in this house, we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: strategic rationale for unity

evidence_collection.quote_text: I’m especially grateful to my wife Cindy, my children, my dear mother, and all my family, and to the many old and dear friends who have stood by my side through the many ups and downs of this long campaign.
evidence_collection.context_type: speaker expresses personal loyalty to his in-group (family, friends), without asserting group superiority

evidence_collection.quote_text: Tonight I hold in my heart nothing but love for this country and for all its citizens, whether they supported me or Senator Obama.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit universal recognition of worth across political divides

evidence_collection.quote_text: America offers opportunities to all who have the industry and will to seize it.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledgment of universal opportunity, implying inherent worth and potential

evidence_collection.quote_text: These are difficult times for our country, and I pledge to him tonight to do all in my power to help him lead us through the many challenges we face.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledges difficulties and challenges, but frames them as problems to overcome rather than existential threats

evidence_collection.quote_text: Whatever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that. It is natural tonight to feel some disappointment, but tomorrow we must move beyond it and work together to get our country moving again.
evidence_collection.context_type: calls for moving beyond disappointment towards collective action and progress

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because nothing is inevitable here. Americans never quit. We never surrender. We never hide from history. We make history.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong, optimistic vision of collective agency and a progressive future

evidence_collection.quote_text: In a contest as long and difficult as this campaign has been, his success alone commands my respect for his ability and perseverance. But that he managed to do so by inspiring the hopes of so many millions of Americans who had once wrongly believed that they had little at stake or little influence in the election of an American president is something I deeply admire and commend him for achieving.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit admiration and commendation for the opponent's achievement and success

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama has achieved a great thing for himself and for his country. I applaud him for it...
evidence_collection.context_type: direct expression of applause and recognition of positive outcomes from opponent's success

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama and I have had our differences, and he has prevailed. No doubt many of those differences remain.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledges past and present differences without expressing hostility or adversarial positioning

evidence_collection.quote_text: I urge all Americans — I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together, to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong appeal for unity, compromise, and collective effort towards shared national goals

evidence_collection.quote_text: Whatever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that.
evidence_collection.context_type: emphasizes shared American identity above political differences, promoting solidarity

evidence_collection.quote_text: I urge all Americans — I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together, to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit call for unity, compromise, and collaboration towards shared national prosperity and security

evidence_collection.quote_text: I call on all Americans, as I have often in this campaign, to not despair of our present difficulties, but to believe always in the promise and greatness of America.
evidence_collection.context_type: calls for collective belief and action towards a unified, positive future for the nation

evidence_collection.quote_text: The American people are outraged at what's going on, and the American people are saying loud and clear, 'We will not accept an oligarchic form of society. We will not accept the richest guy in the world running all over Washington...'
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit 'us' vs. 'them' and assertion of group will

evidence_collection.quote_text: These guys have no sense of what goes on in the real world. They live in another planet.
evidence_collection.context_type: definition of distinct, disconnected out-group

evidence_collection.quote_text: Now everybody wants to do well in life. Everybody wants to make money.
evidence_collection.context_type: implied universal aspiration, but not explicit universal worth

evidence_collection.quote_text: They are prepared to destroy Social Security, Medicaid, Medicare, the Veterans Administration in order to make themselves even richer.
evidence_collection.context_type: description of existential threat to critical social programs

evidence_collection.quote_text: I will tell you this, in the midst of all of these addictions, the worst and most dangerous addiction we have is the greed of the oligarchs.
evidence_collection.context_type: framing an opposing force as a dangerous, pervasive threat

evidence_collection.quote_text: I have every reason to believe deeply in my heart that not only will we defeat Trumpism, but we can create the kind of nation that we deserve.
evidence_collection.context_type: optimistic vision for future contingent on overcoming obstacles

evidence_collection.quote_text: Today you have more concentration of ownership in America than we have ever had... who charge us outrageous prices for the products that we have to buy.
evidence_collection.context_type: resentment over perceived unjust gains of others

evidence_collection.quote_text: there has been a $75 trillion transfer of wealth from the bottom 90% to the top 1%. That is what a rigged economy is about...
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit zero-sum framing of wealth distribution

evidence_collection.context_type: direct opposition and rejection of the identified enemy

evidence_collection.quote_text: And what these guys are busy doing right now is going after Medicaid, going after Social Security, going after nutrition. The rich want to get richer and they don't care who they step on.

evidence_collection.quote_text: This illegal alien beat this boy to death and then he went and bought gasoline and burned his body. He hauled his body out and and put gas and poured gasoline on it and burned this Joshua Wilkinson's body and then he went and took a shower and went to a movie as if it was just another day in the life of. Well, Mr. Speaker, it was another day in, in the life of America and Americans. It's another life loss to an, an illegal criminal alien who was unlawfully present in America, who had no business to be here...
evidence_collection.context_type: strong us-vs-them framing, highlighting threat to in-group

evidence_collection.quote_text: ...people over on this side of the aisle have their fingers in their ears on data. But when they see the faces, when they hear the anguish and the voices, especially of the mothers, or the voice of the father, Scott Root...
evidence_collection.context_type: political in-group/out-group distinction

evidence_collection.quote_text: That being one of God's children is good enough to be protected by the law, but everybody treated equally. Secure our borders.
evidence_collection.context_type: qualified universal dignity, immediately limited by exclusionary border rhetoric

evidence_collection.quote_text: That's 135 dead Americans that would be alive today if the President didn't have the policy of releasing criminal, criminal aliens onto the streets.
evidence_collection.context_type: concern for life, but explicitly limited to national identity

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is costing, it's costing in the end thousands of lives in America.
evidence_collection.context_type: existential threat, direct consequence of policy failures

evidence_collection.quote_text: And it bring you to a sad state of mourn. And you'd lay your head down on the pillow at night having trouble to sleep, thinking, 'What am I going to do tomorrow? I couldn't react today. What am I going to do tomorrow? Lord, wake me up with an idea on how to, how to preserve our Constitution,' if the Supreme Court of the United States believes that they can write law.
evidence_collection.context_type: evokes deep distress and crisis over constitutional integrity

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is the time we must defend our Constitution and we must nominate and elect a President of the United States who will make those appointments to the Supreme Court who believe the Constitution means what it says.
evidence_collection.context_type: reactive goal to restore, not a forward-looking vision

evidence_collection.quote_text: Secure our borders. Restore their respect for the rule of law. Save these lives. Send these people into prison. And when they're done, send them back to the country that they can live in legally for the rest of their lives if they don't stay in our prisons for the rest of their lives.
evidence_collection.context_type: goals are defensive and punitive, not optimistic or cohesive

evidence_collection.quote_text: The Supreme Court ruled with the majority opinion written by the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, but they could add words into Obamacare where it says, 'the states may establish exchanges.' They, they added, 'the states or federal government may establish exchanges.' They made it up.
evidence_collection.context_type: resentment towards perceived illegitimate power grab by Supreme Court

evidence_collection.quote_text: He's demonstrated that in the past with his appointments to the court. He will demonstrate that again. We have a Constitution to preserve, protect, defend, and support and defend.
evidence_collection.context_type: implies resentment of presidential appointments undermining constitutional principles

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have a lame duck President who has made appointments to the Supreme Court who seem to believe that the Constitution means what they want it to mean and they want to read it uh to say what they want it to say rather than what it actually says and rather than what it actually was understood to mean at the time of its ratification.
evidence_collection.context_type: direct adversarial framing of the President and his appointees

evidence_collection.quote_text: This illegal alien beat this boy to death and then he went and bought gasoline and burned his body... It's another life loss to an, an illegal criminal alien who was unlawfully present in America, who had no business to be here...
evidence_collection.context_type: dehumanizing and hostile portrayal of an 'illegal criminal alien'

evidence_collection.quote_text: we here who take an oath to support and defend the Constitution—and that's actually all of us here in the House of Representatives, Mr. Speaker, and everyone in the United States Senate for that matter—we recognize that if we're going to support and defend the Constitution, encouraging the, the nomination and the advice and the consent, the confirmation of the Senate and encouraging then a presidential appointment to the Supreme Court of someone whom the President is incapable of nominating anyone to the Supreme Court that what the Constitution says and what was understood to mean at the time of its ratification, he's demonstrated that in the past with his appointments to the court.
evidence_collection.context_type: conditional in-group amity, immediately followed by criticism of political opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: I thank God for Laura Wilkinson and I ask God to bless the life and the memory and the soul of Joshua Wilkinson who has paid a tremendously high price because we have an ideological President who, I'd say to the other side of the aisle, who's not doing his job.
evidence_collection.context_type: expression of empathy for victims within a partisan framework

evidence_collection.quote_text: We have a lame duck President who has made appointments to the Supreme Court who seem to believe that the Constitution means what they want it to mean and they want to read it uh to say what they want it to say rather than what it actually says and rather than what it actually was understood to mean at the time of its ratification.
evidence_collection.context_type: identifying and condemning those with opposing constitutional interpretations

evidence_collection.quote_text: There's no right in the Constitution for a same-sex marriage... It's a complete manufactured, not just a right, but a command by the Supreme Court of the United States.
evidence_collection.context_type: denying legitimacy of judicial action, fostering division

evidence_collection.quote_text: This is the constitutional structure of this government that we have, Mr. Speaker, and it's, it's a bit um, frustrating for me to listen to the dialogue otherwise that the Senate's not doing their job because they withhold a confirmation, uh, of a presidential appointment when we have a President that has proven that he's not going to put up an appointment that will protect our Constitution.

evidence_collection.quote_text: If you are willing to fight for working people regardless of who they are, how they identify, or where they come from, you are welcome here.
evidence_collection.context_type: inclusive appeal

evidence_collection.quote_text: those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: threat articulation

evidence_collection.quote_text: They're stealing them. They're stealing them. They're stealing them from you and you and me.
evidence_collection.context_type: accusation and urgent threat

evidence_collection.quote_text: we need to come together and spend every day between now and election day working to educate our neighbors, and give Evans and Boebert the boot, and replace them with a brawling Democrat who will stand for Colorado.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to action for positive change

evidence_collection.quote_text: if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: optimistic vision of success

evidence_collection.quote_text: those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: zero-sum framing

evidence_collection.quote_text: They're not working for these billions. They're stealing them. They're stealing them. They're stealing them from you and you and me.
evidence_collection.context_type: accusation of ill-gotten gains

evidence_collection.quote_text: I believe in healthcare, labor, and human dignity, because I was a waitress, because I've scrubbed toilets with my mom to afford school, because I've worked double shifts to keep the lights on, because I lost my dad to cancer as a kid and had to see my mom open hospital bills in the days after.
evidence_collection.context_type: personal narrative of hardship

evidence_collection.quote_text: We are witnessing an oligarchy in America. And that is when those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: designation of adversary

evidence_collection.quote_text: those leaders on either side of the aisle who are willing to put their fellow Americans down... those folks may best find a home somewhere else.
evidence_collection.context_type: exclusion of opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: call for unity

evidence_collection.quote_text: It's about class solidarity.
evidence_collection.context_type: defining shared purpose

evidence_collection.quote_text: we need to come together and spend every day between now and election day working to educate our neighbors, and give Evans and Boebert the boot, and replace them with a brawling Democrat who will stand for Colorado.
evidence_collection.context_type: objective to remove opponents

evidence_collection.quote_text: The same billionaires are taking a wrecking ball to our country
evidence_collection.context_type: description of destructive actions

evidence_collection.quote_text: It's about the thousands of you who came out today to stand together and say, 'Our lives deserve dignity and our work deserves respect.'
evidence_collection.context_type: collective aspiration

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because in this house, we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: strategic rationale for unity

evidence_collection.quote_text: I’m especially grateful to my wife Cindy, my children, my dear mother, and all my family, and to the many old and dear friends who have stood by my side through the many ups and downs of this long campaign.
evidence_collection.context_type: speaker expresses personal loyalty to his in-group (family, friends), without asserting group superiority

evidence_collection.quote_text: Tonight I hold in my heart nothing but love for this country and for all its citizens, whether they supported me or Senator Obama.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit universal recognition of worth across political divides

evidence_collection.quote_text: America offers opportunities to all who have the industry and will to seize it.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledgment of universal opportunity, implying inherent worth and potential

evidence_collection.quote_text: These are difficult times for our country, and I pledge to him tonight to do all in my power to help him lead us through the many challenges we face.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledges difficulties and challenges, but frames them as problems to overcome rather than existential threats

evidence_collection.quote_text: Whatever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that. It is natural tonight to feel some disappointment, but tomorrow we must move beyond it and work together to get our country moving again.
evidence_collection.context_type: calls for moving beyond disappointment towards collective action and progress

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because nothing is inevitable here. Americans never quit. We never surrender. We never hide from history. We make history.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong, optimistic vision of collective agency and a progressive future

evidence_collection.quote_text: In a contest as long and difficult as this campaign has been, his success alone commands my respect for his ability and perseverance. But that he managed to do so by inspiring the hopes of so many millions of Americans who had once wrongly believed that they had little at stake or little influence in the election of an American president is something I deeply admire and commend him for achieving.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit admiration and commendation for the opponent's achievement and success

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama has achieved a great thing for himself and for his country. I applaud him for it...
evidence_collection.context_type: direct expression of applause and recognition of positive outcomes from opponent's success

evidence_collection.quote_text: Senator Obama and I have had our differences, and he has prevailed. No doubt many of those differences remain.
evidence_collection.context_type: acknowledges past and present differences without expressing hostility or adversarial positioning

evidence_collection.quote_text: I urge all Americans — I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together, to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
evidence_collection.context_type: strong appeal for unity, compromise, and collective effort towards shared national goals

evidence_collection.quote_text: Whatever our differences, we are fellow Americans, and please believe me when I say no association has ever meant more to me than that.
evidence_collection.context_type: emphasizes shared American identity above political differences, promoting solidarity

evidence_collection.quote_text: I urge all Americans — I urge all Americans who supported me to join me in not just congratulating him, but offering our next president our good will and earnest effort to find ways to come together, to find the necessary compromises to bridge our differences and help restore our prosperity, defend our security in a dangerous world, and leave our children and grandchildren a stronger, better country than we inherited.
evidence_collection.context_type: explicit call for unity, compromise, and collaboration towards shared national prosperity and security

evidence_collection.quote_text: I call on all Americans, as I have often in this campaign, to not despair of our present difficulties, but to believe always in the promise and greatness of America.
evidence_collection.context_type: calls for collective belief and action towards a unified, positive future for the nation

evidence_collection.quote_text: We are witnessing an oligarchy in America. And that is when those with the most economic, political, and technological power destroy the public good to enrich themselves while millions of Americans pay the price.
evidence_collection.context_type: problem framing

evidence_collection.quote_text: Because in this house, we stand together, we know that, that it's our only choice because we know that without exception, if we stand together, it is the only way that we can win.
evidence_collection.context_type: call to action
